issues.description: The default constructor of Person in the solution code is package-private, but client code in PersonScene (and the template) calls new Person() from a different package. This constructor visibility mismatch will cause compilation errors and blocks students from instantiating Person objects as intended.
issues.suggested_fix: Declare the Person default constructor as public in the solution code (and ensure the template’s constructor remains public) so that client-side code can instantiate Person objects as intended.

issues.description: In the problem statement (lines 150–152) the methods for the PersonController are said to take a `Consumer<List<Note>>`, but in both the template and solution the methods actually use `Consumer<List<Person>>`. This mismatch will confuse students when they try to implement PersonController based on the instructions.
issues.suggested_fix: In the problem statement, replace `Consumer<List<Note>>` with `Consumer<List<Person>>` when describing the PersonController methods so it matches the template and expected implementation.
